english_translation: Narrated by Amr ibn al-Harith, the brother-in-law of the Prophet ﷺ (brother of his wife): By Allah, the Messenger of Allah ﷺ did not leave a dinar or dirham or a slave or maidservant or anything except his white mule and his weapon, and what he left is charity.

Amr ibn al-Harith uses indirect transmission term (عن) rather than direct hearing

potential_issues.issue: Multiple weak narrators in the chain

english_translation: Narrated by Khubaib ibn Abd al-Rahman ibn Khubaib al-Juhani from his father from his grandfather: The Messenger of Allah ﷺ went out intending a direction and proceeded. I and a man from my people followed him. We said: We dislike that our people witness a scene (battle/expedition) that we do not witness with them. He said: Have you both submitted (to Islam)? We said: No. He said: Indeed, we do not seek aid from the polytheists against the polytheists. So we both submitted and witnessed with him.

english_translation: Abu Khunis al-Ghifari, may Allah be pleased with him

chainIssues: No chain or hadith text

potential_issues.issue: Header only
potential_issues.impact: No hadith content

english_translation: Narrated by Abu Khunis al-Ghifari: I went out with the Messenger of Allah ﷺ in the Tihamah expedition. When we reached Usfan, his companions came to him and said: O Messenger of Allah, hunger has afflicted us, so permit us to eat the beasts of burden. He said: Yes. Umar was informed of this, so he came to the Prophet ﷺ saying: O Prophet of Allah, what have you done? You commanded the people to eat the beasts of burden, what will they ride? He said: What do you see, O son of Khattab? Umar said: I see you command them, and you are the best in judgment, to gather surplus provisions in a cloth and call upon the Messenger of Allah ﷺ for them, for surely Allah the Mighty and Majestic will answer you. So he commanded them and they gathered surplus provisions in a cloth and the Messenger of Allah ﷺ invoked blessings for them. Then he said: Bring your containers and each person filled his container from it. Then the Messenger of Allah ﷺ gave permission to depart. When they departed, they were rained upon as much as they wished. Then they descended and drank from the water of heaven while they were at al-Kira. Then he gave a sermon to them. Three men came forward. Two sat with the Prophet ﷺ while another turned away. The Prophet ﷺ said: Shall I inform you about these three men? As for one, he felt shy before Allah, so Allah the Mighty and Majestic felt shy before him. As for another, he came repentant to Allah the Mighty and Majestic, so Allah repented upon him. As for another, he turned away, so Allah the Mighty and Majestic turned away from him.
